headline.main: A Sharp Turn for the Supreme Court on Abortion (9 Letters)
headline.print_headline: A Sharp Turn for the Supreme Court on Abortion

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''In Reversal of Course, Justices, 5-4, Back Ban on Abortion Method'' (front page, April 19):

headline.main: A Sharp Turn for the Supreme Court on Abortion

docs.abstract: Nine letters comment on Supreme Court decision upholding ban on some late-term abortions (Apr 19 article); Joan Malin, president and chief executive of Planned Parenthood, calls decision assault on women's health and rights and says Americans should be outraged; Dr Deborah Oyer, board member of National Abortion Federation, abhors decision because it injects government into doctor-patient relationship; Rabbi Avi Shafran, public affairs director of Agudath Israel of America, says abortion procedure prohibited by decision is, in effect, infanticide; Emily Rubin argues decision puts doctors in precarious position; Lawrence Longua abhors Apr 19 editorial on Supreme Court decision; Jennifer Rolnick says decision is clear assault on women's rights; Bonnie O'Neil applauds decision; Aviva Briefel finds decision troubling because it places higher value on fetus than woman; Dr George Ehrlich is appalled by decision; drawing
docs.snippet: To the Editor:     Re ''In Reversal of Course, Justices, 5-4, Back Ban on Abortion Method'' (front page, April 19):

docs.lead_paragraph: Pondering how to sell circumcision, a life-saving procedure, to the squeamish American male.

headline.main: Preventing H.I.V., but at What Price?
headline.print_headline: Preventing H.I.V., but at What Price?

docs.snippet: Pondering how to sell circumcision, a life-saving procedure, to the squeamish American male.
